abstract.p: Debra Samuels Wurzel is named executive vice president and managing director at Campbell-Ewald, succeeding Ian MacGregor, who is named executive vice president and general manager at Los Angeles office of sibling, McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising; Debbie Karnowsky, executive vice president and executive creative director at office in Warren, Mich, is relocating to Los Angeles with same titles; Jim Klock, senior vice president and account director in Warren, is named executive vice president and account director in Los Angeles (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: Campbell-Ewald in Warren, Mich., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, has made management changes in its Los Angeles office.

Debra Samuels Wurzel, 43, was named executive vice president and managing director, succeeding Ian McGregor, who became executive vice president and general manager at the Los Angeles office of a sibling, McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of Interpublic. Ms. Wurzel had been executive vice president and management representative at Grey Advertising in Los Angeles.
Campbell-Ewald in Warren, Mich., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, has made management changes in its Los Angeles office.

Debra Samuels Wurzel, 43, was named executive vice president and managing director, succeeding Ian McGregor, who became executive vice president and general manager at the Los Angeles office of a sibling, McCann-Erickson Worldwide Advertising, part of the McCann-Erickson World Group unit of Interpublic. Ms. Wurzel had been executive vice president and management representative at Grey Advertising in Los Angeles.

Debbie Karnowsky, 51, executive vice president and executive creative director at the Warren office, is relocating to Los Angeles with the same titles. And Jim Klock, 55, senior vice president and account director in Warren, was named executive vice president and account director in Los Angeles. The Farmers Insurance account shifts to Los Angeles as well.
